snippet: To follow horse racing is to become a connoisseur of bad luck.
abstract: Op-Ed article by New York Institute for the Humanities director Eric Banks chronicles years of personal financial losses while betting on Belmont Stakes horse races; holds that to follow horse racing is to become connoisseur of mistakes and bad luck; welcomes prospect of Triple Crown win by horse California Chrome and new legions of fans that it has drawn to the sport, but warns that all may end in disappointment.
lead_paragraph: To follow horse racing is to become a connoisseur of bad luck.
